question: 憂き目
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Grief</kanji> shows in your <kanji>eye</kanji>s by making them look like you've gone through a lot of <vocabulary>bitterness</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>hardship</vocabulary>. You can always see it in someone else if you look them in the eyes too.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This word uses the kun'yomi readings for the kanji. You kind of learned this reading for <ja>憂</ja>, but not exactly. Here's a mnemonic to help you remember it: 

The <vocabulary>bitterness</vocabulary> that shows in your eyes takes the <reading>ray</reading>s (<ja>れ</ja>) of light out of them, leaving you with just the <ja>う</ja> part of the reading that you know. That's why this reading is just <ja>う</ja> and not <ja>うれ</ja> like the others.
